intro: Pavetta silvae, commonly known as the forest pavetta, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forests and woodlands. Its leaves are usually opposite, ovate, and have a smooth or slightly hairy texture. Pavetta silvae is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitats.
